learning_outcomes.description: Investigate and document a client's communication and/or swallowing condition and explore the primary concerns of the client

Identify the communication and/or swallowing conditions requiring investigation and use the best available scientific and clinical evidence to determine the most suitable assessment procedures in partnership with the client
Analyse and interpret speech pathology assessment data to determine the basis for, or diagnosis of, the communication and/or swallowing condition and possible outcomes
Provide concise and informative case descriptions, clear reporting of assessment analysis and interpretation, and documentation of evidence-based case management
Critically evaluate speech pathology assessment and management literature
Plan short- and long-term goals/outcomes for clients using a person- and family-centred care approach
Demonstrate appropriate teamwork and professional interaction with other 'clinicians' in the planning and implementation of management for a client with complex issues

assessments.due_date:
Week 1 - Week 6

All quizzes will be submitted 10 minutes after the start of each class.
assessments.task_description:
There will be a 10-minute quiz at the beginning of each class (12 in total). Your 10 best quizzes will make up your grade (2% each). Your worst 2 quizzes (which may include any missed quizzes) will not contribute to your grade.

The first quiz will relate to your prior experience with evidence-based practice. The next 6 quizzes will relate to journal articles that you will need to read before each class. The final 5 quizzes will be based on the group case presentations.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Students will work in groups to prepare multi-faceted case seminars.

Students will self-allocate to 10 groups, and presentation dates will be randomly assigned. 

Each group will produce a 30-minute presentation of a multi-faceted complex case in which the major clinical and professional issues relevant to a case are identified and discussed. A complex case is defined as one in which multiple factors influence speech pathology assessment and management, rather than a single, straightforward issue (e.g. 4 year old child with 2-3 sounds in error). An example of a complex case could be a patient experiencing dysarthria and dysphagia, plus depression and impaired mobility; management may have required a complex multidisciplinary approach; or perhaps there are additional social or psychosocial issues that made management complex and required you to do something different in order to optimise treatment for this child/adult (e.g., family issues, service issues, resource difficulties). There are no set criteria for determining what represents a complex case however, simple or rapidly resolving cases are not suitable. Your chosen case should allow you to demonstrate clinical reasoning, problem‑solving, and professional decision‑making in the context of complexity for your patient.

All students must play a role in developing the presentation, and in presenting on the day. There will be 10 minutes for questions, and responses to questions will contribute to the mark received.

The marking criteria are available on Blackboard and should be used to help structure the presentation.

When a student is required to complete an oral or practical assessment item worth 20% or more, the performance will be recorded and retained per Appendix 1. (Assessment Procedure (95))

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
You will analyse a case, including appraising a relevant paper and describing how you would manage the case based on the principles of EBP. Details of the assignment will be provided on blackboard.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorials

Tutorial content will include evaluation of research evidence, holistic management of multi-faceted cases, clinical reasoning and decision making, prioritisation of goals, case-based clinical reasoning scenarios, and applying evidence-based practice in the workplace. 14 hours total.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorials Tutorial content will include evaluation of research evidence, holistic management of multi-faceted cases, clinical reasoning and decision making, prioritisation of goals, case-based clinical reasoning scenarios, and applying evidence-based practice in the workplace. 14 hours total.

learning_activities.topic:
Group Case Presentations

Groups will develop and present a seminar on a multi-faceted complex case. 10 hours total.
